segment.source: How to Apply a Package Accelerator to Create a Virtual Application Package (App-V 4.6 SP1)
segment.target: How to Apply a Package Accelerator to Create a Virtual Application Package (App-V 4.6 SP1)

segment.source: How to Apply a Package Accelerator to Create a Virtual Application Package (App-V 4.6 SP1)
segment.target: How to Apply a Package Accelerator to Create a Virtual Application Package (App-V 4.6 SP1)

segment.source: How to Apply a Package Accelerator to Create a Virtual Application Package (App-V 4.6 SP1)
segment.target: How to Apply a Package Accelerator to Create a Virtual Application Package (App-V 4.6 SP1)

segment.source: You can use App-V Package Accelerators to automatically generate a new virtual application package.
segment.target: You can use App-V Package Accelerators to automatically generate a new virtual application package.

segment.source: For more information about Package Accelerators, see About App-V Package Accelerators (App-V 4.6 SP1).
segment.target: For more information about Package Accelerators, see About App-V Package Accelerators (App-V 4.6 SP1).

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: Disclaimer: The Application Virtualization Sequencer does not give you any license rights to the software application you are using to create a Package Accelerator.
segment.target: Disclaimer: The Application Virtualization Sequencer does not give you any license rights to the software application you are using to create a Package Accelerator.

segment.source: You must abide by all end user license terms for such application.
segment.target: You must abide by all end user license terms for such application.

segment.source: It is your responsibility to make sure the software application’s license terms allow you to create a Package Accelerator using Application Virtualization Sequencer.
segment.target: It is your responsibility to make sure the software application’s license terms allow you to create a Package Accelerator using Application Virtualization Sequencer.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: Before starting this procedure, copy the required Package Accelerator locally to the computer running the App-V Sequencer.
segment.target: Before starting this procedure, copy the required Package Accelerator locally to the computer running the App-V Sequencer.

segment.source: You should also copy all required installation files for the package to a local directory on the computer running the Sequencer.
segment.target: You should also copy all required installation files for the package to a local directory on the computer running the Sequencer.

segment.source: This is the directory that you have to specify in step 5 of this procedure.
segment.target: This is the directory that you have to specify in step 5 of this procedure.

segment.source: Use the following procedure to create a virtual application package by using a Package Accelerator.
segment.target: Use the following procedure to create a virtual application package by using a Package Accelerator.

segment.source: To create a virtual application package by using an App-V Package Accelerator
segment.target: To create a virtual application package by using an App-V Package Accelerator

segment.source: To start the App-V Sequencer, on the computer that is running the App-V Sequencer, click StartAll ProgramsMicrosoft Application VirtualizationMicrosoft Application Virtualization Sequencer.
segment.target: To start the App-V Sequencer, on the computer that is running the App-V Sequencer, click StartAll ProgramsMicrosoft Application VirtualizationMicrosoft Application Virtualization Sequencer.

segment.source: To start the Create New Package Wizard, click Create a New Virtual Application Package.
segment.target: To start the Create New Package Wizard, click Create a New Virtual Application Package.

segment.source: To create the package, select the Create Package using a Package Accelerator check box, and then click Next.
segment.target: To create the package, select the Create Package using a Package Accelerator check box, and then click Next.

segment.source: On the Select Package Accelerator page, to specify the Package Accelerator that will be used to create the new virtual application package, click Browse to locate the Package Accelerator that you want to use.
segment.target: On the Select Package Accelerator page, to specify the Package Accelerator that will be used to create the new virtual application package, click Browse to locate the Package Accelerator that you want to use.

segment.source: Click Next.
segment.target: Click Next.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: If the publisher of the Package Accelerator cannot be verified and does not contain a valid digital signature, in the Security Warning dialog box, you must confirm that you trust the source of the Package Accelerator before you click Run.
segment.target: If the publisher of the Package Accelerator cannot be verified and does not contain a valid digital signature, in the Security Warning dialog box, you must confirm that you trust the source of the Package Accelerator before you click Run.

segment.source: On the Guidance page, review the publishing guidance information displayed in the information pane.
segment.target: On the Guidance page, review the publishing guidance information displayed in the information pane.

segment.source: The information displayed was added when the Package Accelerator was created and contains information about creating and publishing the package.
segment.target: The information displayed was added when the Package Accelerator was created and contains information about creating and publishing the package.

segment.source: To export the guidance information to a text (.txt) file, click Export and specify the location where the file should be saved, and then click Next.
segment.target: To export the guidance information to a text (.txt) file, click Export and specify the location where the file should be saved, and then click Next.

segment.source: On the Select Installation Files page, to create a local folder that contains all required installation files for the package, click Make New Folder and specify where the folder should be saved.
segment.target: On the Select Installation Files page, to create a local folder that contains all required installation files for the package, click Make New Folder and specify where the folder should be saved.

segment.source: You must also specify a name to be assigned to the folder.
segment.target: You must also specify a name to be assigned to the folder.

segment.source: You must then copy all required installation files to the location that you specified.
segment.target: You must then copy all required installation files to the location that you specified.

segment.source: If the folder that contains the installation files already exists on the computer running the Sequencer, click Browse to select the folder.
segment.target: If the folder that contains the installation files already exists on the computer running the Sequencer, click Browse to select the folder.

segment.source: Alternatively, if you have already copied the installation files to a directory on this computer, click Make New Folder, browse to the folder that contains the installation files, and then click Next.
segment.target: Alternatively, if you have already copied the installation files to a directory on this computer, click Make New Folder, browse to the folder that contains the installation files, and then click Next.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: You can specify the following types of supported installation files:
segment.target: You can specify the following types of supported installation files:

segment.source: Windows Installer files(.msi
segment.target: Windows Installer files(.msi

segment.source: .cab files
segment.target: .cab files

segment.source: Compressed files with a .zip file name extension
segment.target: Compressed files with a .zip file name extension

segment.source: The actual application files
segment.target: The actual application files

segment.source: The following file types are not supported: .msp and.exe files.
segment.target: The following file types are not supported: .msp and.exe files.

segment.source: If you specify an .exe file you must extract the installation files manually.
segment.target: If you specify an .exe file you must extract the installation files manually.

segment.source: If the Package Accelerator requires an application be installed prior to applying the Package Accelerator and you have installed the application, on the Local Installation page, select the check box I have installed all applications, and then click Next.
segment.target: If the Package Accelerator requires an application be installed prior to applying the Package Accelerator and you have installed the application, on the Local Installation page, select the check box I have installed all applications, and then click Next.

segment.source: On the Package Name page, specify a name that will be associated with the package.
segment.target: On the Package Name page, specify a name that will be associated with the package.

segment.source: The name specified identifies the package in the App-V Management Console.
segment.target: The name specified identifies the package in the App-V Management Console.

segment.source: Click Next.
segment.target: Click Next.

segment.source: On the Create Package page, provide comments that will be associated with the package.
segment.target: On the Create Package page, provide comments that will be associated with the package.

segment.source: The comments should contain identifying information about the package you are creating.
segment.target: The comments should contain identifying information about the package you are creating.

segment.source: To confirm the location where the package is created, review the information displayed in Save Location.
segment.target: To confirm the location where the package is created, review the information displayed in Save Location.

segment.source: To compress the package, select Compress Package.
segment.target: To compress the package, select Compress Package.

segment.source: Select the Compress Package check box if the package will be streamed across the network, or when the package size exceeds 4 GB.
segment.target: Select the Compress Package check box if the package will be streamed across the network, or when the package size exceeds 4 GB.

segment.source: To create the package, click Create.
segment.target: To create the package, click Create.

segment.source: After the package has been created, click Next.
segment.target: After the package has been created, click Next.

segment.source: On the Configure Software page, to enable the Sequencer to configure the applications contained in the package, select Configure Software.
segment.target: On the Configure Software page, to enable the Sequencer to configure the applications contained in the package, select Configure Software.

segment.source: This step is useful for configuring any associated tasks that must be completed to run the application on target computers, such as configuring any associated license agreements.
segment.target: This step is useful for configuring any associated tasks that must be completed to run the application on target computers, such as configuring any associated license agreements.

segment.source: If you select Configure Software, the following items are configured by the Sequencer as part of this step:
segment.target: If you select Configure Software, the following items are configured by the Sequencer as part of this step:

segment.source: Load Package.
segment.target: Load Package.

segment.source: The Sequencer loads the files associated with the package.
segment.target: The Sequencer loads the files associated with the package.

segment.source: It can take several seconds to up to an hour to decode the package.
segment.target: It can take several seconds to up to an hour to decode the package.

segment.source: Run Each Program.
segment.target: Run Each Program.

segment.source: Optionally run the programs contained in the package.
segment.target: Optionally run the programs contained in the package.

segment.source: This step is helpful for completing any associated license or configuration tasks that are required to run the application before you deploy and run the package on target computers.
segment.target: This step is helpful for completing any associated license or configuration tasks that are required to run the application before you deploy and run the package on target computers.

segment.source: To run all the programs at one time, select at least one program, and then click Run All.
segment.target: To run all the programs at one time, select at least one program, and then click Run All.

segment.source: To run specific programs, select the program or programs you want to run, and then click Run Selected.
segment.target: To run specific programs, select the program or programs you want to run, and then click Run Selected.

segment.source: Complete the required configuration tasks, and then close the applications.
segment.target: Complete the required configuration tasks, and then close the applications.

segment.source: It can take several minutes for all programs to run.
segment.target: It can take several minutes for all programs to run.

segment.source: Click Next.
segment.target: Click Next.

segment.source: Save Package.
segment.target: Save Package.

segment.source: The Sequencer saves the package.
segment.target: The Sequencer saves the package.

segment.source: Primary Feature Block.
segment.target: Primary Feature Block.

segment.source: The Sequencer optimizes the package for streaming by rebuilding the primary feature block.
segment.target: The Sequencer optimizes the package for streaming by rebuilding the primary feature block.

segment.source: If you do not want to configure the applications, click Skip this step, and to go to step 9 of this procedure, and then click Next.
segment.target: If you do not want to configure the applications, click Skip this step, and to go to step 9 of this procedure, and then click Next.

segment.source: On the Completion page, after you have reviewed the information displayed in the Virtual Application Package Report pane, click Close.
segment.target: On the Completion page, after you have reviewed the information displayed in the Virtual Application Package Report pane, click Close.

segment.source: The package is now available in the Sequencer.
segment.target: The package is now available in the Sequencer.

segment.source: To edit the package properties, click Edit Package Name.
segment.target: To edit the package properties, click Edit Package Name.

segment.source: For more information about modifying a package, see How to Modify an Existing Virtual Application Package (App-V 4.6 SP1).
segment.target: For more information about modifying a package, see How to Modify an Existing Virtual Application Package (App-V 4.6 SP1).

segment.source: Related topics
segment.target: Related topics

segment.source: Configuring the Application Virtualization Sequencer (App-V 4.6 SP1)
segment.target: Configuring the Application Virtualization Sequencer (App-V 4.6 SP1)

segment.target: How to Create App-V Package Accelerators (App-V 4.6 SP1)
